intro: Espeletia jahnii, commonly known as the Jahn's espeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean highlands of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its rosette growth form. The plant produces dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Espeletia jahnii is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool, dry climates. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important component of the Andean flora.
